Posts.EditableText: Hello, everyone! I'm Daniele, 42, from Italy. I'm disabled (spina bifida), and I guess this has always given me the chance to expand and strengthen my imagination. Needless to say that when I stumbled on my first adventure game (can't remember if it was The Hobbit... or if it was an article on Commodore Computer Club, a monthly magazine about programming the Commodore computers)... well, it was love at first sight. Actually, at first read, haha! There's so much power, "hidden" in that "simple" sequence of words... and it's amazing to think that anyone can make, in its own mind, a very unique interpretation of the same description! To be honest, back in those days I didn't really end any of them. Years after, in the 90s I returned to them. And so I did in the 2000s... and so I'm doing now. Once in a while, the urge to return to those fascinating interactive stories just can't be resisted. Last autumn I wrote a text adventure (I still like and prefer to call them like that)... maybe one day I'll find the courage to post it somewhere. And, in the same time, I ended up conceiveing and producing a series of TA-themed apparel. The artwork is mine, and so the texts, each one being an excerpt of an imaginary text adventure. So far I've put online 3 of my ideas about it (I've opened the store a few days ago), but I've already more than 60 planned! (I also have another series running, in the same store, about the truest nature of people...) If you want, feel free to pay a visit to my virtual store! [EDIT] The first one of the IF-themed apparel items: http://www.zazzle.co.uk/text_adventures ... 9866619110 ...a second one: http://www.zazzle.co.uk/text_adventures ... 0647423776 ...and a third one: http://www.zazzle.co.uk/text_adventures ... 5492873252 Each day I'll try to add one. What's your opinion? Please, let me know! P.S. By the way, there would be many, many more things to say about me... I'm into computer science, I play guitar by ear, I love music both as a listener and as a composer (self-taught, once on trackers, now on the virtual symphonic orchestra), I love literature both as a reader and as a writer... I love to cook, once in a while... I've been teaching myself computer graphic, as you can see from the artwork of this apparel... I love creativity, in some of its countless aspects... I love life! Thank you for reading!

Hello, everyone!

I'm Daniele, 42, from Italy.
I'm disabled (spina bifida), and I guess this has always given me the chance to expand and strengthen my imagination.

Needless to say that when I stumbled on my first adventure game (can't remember if it was The Hobbit... or if it was an article on Commodore Computer Club, a monthly magazine about programming the Commodore computers)... well, it was love at first sight.
Actually, at first read, haha!

There's so much power, "hidden" in that "simple" sequence of words... and it's amazing to think that anyone can make, in its own mind, a very unique interpretation of the same description!

To be honest, back in those days I didn't really end any of them.
Years after, in the 90s I returned to them.
And so I did in the 2000s... and so I'm doing now.
Once in a while, the urge to return to those fascinating interactive stories just can't be resisted.

Last autumn I wrote a text adventure (I still like and prefer to call them like that)... maybe one day I'll find the courage to post it somewhere.

And, in the same time, I ended up conceiveing and producing a series of TA-themed apparel.
The artwork is mine, and so the texts, each one being an excerpt of an imaginary text adventure.

So far I've put online 3 of my ideas about it (I've opened the store a few days ago), but I've already more than 60 planned!
(I also have another series running, in the same store, about the truest nature of people...)

If you want, feel free to pay a visit to my virtual store!

Each day I'll try to add one.
What's your opinion? Please, let me know!

P.S.
By the way, there would be many, many more things to say about me...
I'm into computer science, I play guitar by ear, I love music both as a listener and as a composer (self-taught, once on trackers, now on the virtual symphonic orchestra), I love literature both as a reader and as a writer... I love to cook, once in a while... I've been teaching myself computer graphic, as you can see from the artwork of this apparel... I love creativity, in some of its countless aspects... I love life!

Thank you for reading!
